results.title: Contemporary painting 1950-1979
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
Features “The Harbour from McMahon’s Point” - Looks at the work of Lloyd Rees. “Epiphany” - A powerful painting by Ian Fairweather. “Self portrait in the Studio” - by Brett Whiteley - “Truck and Trailer Heading into a City” - Examines the work of Jeffrey Smart. “Waterfall Polyptych” - by Fred Williams.

results.title: Consumer protection
results.brief_description: A comparison of the buying habits of two American families - the Kings and the Whites. The Whites’ buying habits are based on the price and appearance of the product, while the Kings take advantage of consumer services offered in the USA, and thus make sure that they only buy the best.
results.description: A comparison of the buying habits of two American families - the Kings and the Whites. results.title: Conspiracy
results.creator_credit: Daryl Dellora, Sue Maslin, Film Art Doco Pty Ltd and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: ‘Conspiracy’ is a dramatic and thought provoking investigation into the bomb attack at the Sydney Hilton Hotel in 1978. It does so through stylised re-enactments and studio interviews and poses such troubling questions as how the bombers managed to evade a huge security operation, mounted at a Commonwealth level. ‘Conspiracy’ ponders where the bomb was made, the questionable preparedness of the bomb disposal unit, and the abandonment of sniffer dogs prior to the incident. These questions were first asked years ago, they are continuing to be asked at a Federal level in parliament.

results.title: Consolation prize
results.creator_credit: Rivka Hartman and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A humorous short film. Rivka Hartman draws on the silent film aesthetic and borrows its stylistic tendencies to recreate a world full of slap-stick, fantasy and drama. Young Sally Shambles (Rivka Hartman) is a naive young lady whose readiness for love leads her into a number of predicaments with men, all unsuccessful. She daydreams about her prospects and potential loves, but just can’t seem to get the method right. Written by Rivka Hartman.

results.title: Conservation school. No. 2. Water
results.creator_credit: Carl Pryer Jr, United States Information Service and United States. Soil Conservation Service
results.brief_description: The story of water - its numerous values and its potential destructive power unless controlled. This film develops the theme that water is essential to all life; the most valuable water is that which soaks into the ground where it falls as rain or snow. Destructive water is that which is permitted to run off uncontrolled from the ground on which it falls. The disadvantages of a very low rainfall, or a very high rainfall, are demonstrated, and remedial measures which can be applied through the use of soil and water conservation practices are shown.

results.title: Conservation of energy
results.creator_credit: Norton Bloom, Kevin Smith and Educational Services
results.brief_description: Traces energy from coal to electical output in a large power plant. Demonstrates the conservation law for random and orderly motion. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Conservation for beginners
results.brief_description: Shows how to conserve soil and water, how conservation affects crops and farm animals, and how forests and wildlife benefit from conservation. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Consequences: spinal cord injury
results.creator_credit: Peter M Jamero, Barry Corbet and University of Washington
results.brief_description: Contrasts the excitement and exhilaration of adventure sports such as surfing, motorcycling, skiing, skateboarding and hang gliding, with the potential consequences of spinal cord injury and permanent paralysis. Emphasises learning your limitations, respecting them and recognising the risks.

results.title: Connie the cow: a curious butterfly
results.creator_credit: Josep Viciana, Cristina Brandner and Neptuno Films
results.brief_description: Join Connie the Cow, the very curious cow, in six colourful animated adventures. We all know that Connie loves to explore, make new friends and play. She is young and very mischievous. Every morning she wakes to explore the farm with her friends and brings about some exciting adventures. Music by Josep Roig.
